00049 // ----------------------------------------------------- //

00051 {

00081 // ----------------------------------------------------- //
00082 int bDNA::getReverseType(short type)
00083 {
00084 
00085         int* intPtr = mStructReverse.find(type);
00086         if (intPtr)
00087                 return *intPtr;
00088 
00089         return -1;
00090 }
00091 
00092 // ----------------------------------------------------- //
00093 int bDNA::getReverseType(const char *type)
00094 {
00095 
00096         b3HashString key(type);
00097         int* valuePtr = mTypeLookup.find(key);
00098         if (valuePtr)
00099                 return *valuePtr;
00100         
00101         return -1;
00102 }

00111 bool bDNA::flagNotEqual(int dna_nr)
00112 {
00113         assert(dna_nr <=        (int)mCMPFlags.size());
00114         return mCMPFlags[dna_nr] == FDF_STRUCT_NEQU;

00117 // ----------------------------------------------------- //
00118 bool bDNA::flagEqual(int dna_nr)
00119 {
00120         assert(dna_nr <=        (int)mCMPFlags.size());
00121         int flag = mCMPFlags[dna_nr];
00122         return  flag == FDF_STRUCT_EQU;
00123 }

00126 bool bDNA::flagNone(int dna_nr)
00127 {

00129         return mCMPFlags[dna_nr] == FDF_NONE;

00138 // ----------------------------------------------------- //
00139 void bDNA::initRecurseCmpFlags(int iter)
00140 {
00141         // iter is FDF_STRUCT_NEQU
00142 
00143         short *oldStrc = mStructs[iter];
00144         short type = oldStrc[0];
00145 
00146         for (int i=0; i<(int)mStructs.size(); i++)
00147         {
00148                 if (i != iter && mCMPFlags[i] == FDF_STRUCT_EQU )
00149                 {
00150                         short *curStruct = mStructs[i];
00151                         int eleLen = curStruct[1];
00152                         curStruct+=2;
00153 
00154                         for (int j=0; j<eleLen; j++, curStruct+=2)
00155                         {
00156                                 if (curStruct[0] == type)
00157                                 {
00158                                         //char *name = m_Names[curStruct[1]].m_name;
00159                                         //if (name[0] != '*')
00160                                         if (m_Names[curStruct[1]].m_isPointer)
00161                                         {
00162                                                 mCMPFlags[i] = FDF_STRUCT_NEQU;
00163                                                 initRecurseCmpFlags(i);
00164                                         }
00165                                 }
00166                         }
00167                 }
00168         }
00169 }

00171 // ----------------------------------------------------- //
00172 void bDNA::initCmpFlags(bDNA *memDNA)
00173 {
00174 
00175     // compare the file to memory
00176         // this ptr should be the file data
00177 
00178 
00179         assert(!(m_Names.size() == 0));// && "SDNA empty!");
00180         mCMPFlags.resize(mStructs.size(), FDF_NONE);
00181 
00182 
00183 
00184         int i;
00185         for ( i=0; i<(int)mStructs.size(); i++)
00186         {
00187                 short *oldStruct = mStructs[i];
00188 
00189                 int oldLookup = getReverseType(oldStruct[0]);
00190                 if (oldLookup == -1)
00191                 {
00192                         mCMPFlags[i] = FDF_NONE;
00193                         continue;
00194                 }
00195                 //char* typeName = mTypes[oldStruct[0]];
00196 
00197 //#define SLOW_FORWARD_COMPATIBLE 1
00198 #ifdef SLOW_FORWARD_COMPATIBLE
00199                 char* typeName = mTypes[oldLookup];
00200                 int newLookup = memDNA->getReverseType(typeName);
00201                 if (newLookup == -1)
00202                 {
00203                         mCMPFlags[i] = FDF_NONE;
00204                         continue;
00205                 }
00206                 short *curStruct = memDNA->mStructs[newLookup];
00207 #else
00208                 // memory for file
00209 
00210                 if (oldLookup < memDNA->mStructs.size())
00211                 {
00212                         short *curStruct = memDNA->mStructs[oldLookup];
00213 #endif  
00214         
00215                 
00216 
00217                         // rebuild...
00218                         mCMPFlags[i] = FDF_STRUCT_NEQU;
00219 
00220 #ifndef TEST_BACKWARD_FORWARD_COMPATIBILITY
00221 
00222                         if (curStruct[1] == oldStruct[1])
00223                         {
00224                                 // type len same ...
00225                                 if (mTlens[oldStruct[0]] == memDNA->mTlens[curStruct[0]])
00226                                 {
00227                                         bool isSame = true;
00228                                         int elementLength = oldStruct[1];
00229 
00230 
00231                                         curStruct+=2;
00232                                         oldStruct+=2;
00233 
00234 
00235                                         for (int j=0; j<elementLength; j++, curStruct+=2, oldStruct+=2)
00236                                         {
00237                                                 // type the same
00238                                                 //const char* typeFileDNA = mTypes[oldStruct[0]];
00239                                                 //const char* typeMemDNA = mTypes[curStruct[0]];
00240                                                 if (strcmp(mTypes[oldStruct[0]], memDNA->mTypes[curStruct[0]])!=0)
00241                                                 {
00242                                                         isSame=false;
00243                                                         break;
00244                                                 }
00245 
00246                                                 // name the same
00247                                                 if (strcmp(m_Names[oldStruct[1]].m_name, memDNA->m_Names[curStruct[1]].m_name)!=0)
00248                                                 {
00249                                                         isSame=false;
00250                                                         break;
00251                                                 }
00252                                         }
00253                                         // flag valid ==
00254                                         if (isSame)
00255                                                 mCMPFlags[i] = FDF_STRUCT_EQU;
00256                                 }
00257                         }
00258 #endif
00259                 }
00260         }
00261 
00262 
00263 
00264 
00265 
00266         // recurse in
00267         for ( i=0; i<(int)mStructs.size(); i++)
00268         {
00269                 if (mCMPFlags[i] == FDF_STRUCT_NEQU)
00270                         initRecurseCmpFlags(i);
00271         }
00272 }

00277 static int name_is_array(char* name, int* dim1, int* dim2) {
00278         int len = strlen(name);
00279         /*fprintf(stderr,"[%s]",name);*/
00280         /*if (len >= 1) {
00281         if (name[len-1] != ']')
00282         return 1;
00283         }
00284         return 0;*/
00285         char *bp;
00286         int num;
00287         if (dim1) {
00288                 *dim1 = 1;
00289         }
00290         if (dim2) {
00291                 *dim2 = 1;
00292         }
00293         bp = strchr(name, '[');
00294         if (!bp) {
00295                 return 0;
00296         }
00297         num = 0;
00298         while (++bp < name+len-1) {
00299                 const char c = *bp;
00300                 if (c == ']') {
00301                         break;
00302                 }
00303                 if (c <= '9' && c >= '0') {
00304                         num *= 10;
00305                         num += (c - '0');
00306                 } else {
00307                         printf("array parse error.\n");
00308                         return 0;
00309                 }
00310         }
00311         if (dim2) {
00312                 *dim2 = num;
00313         }
00314 
00315         /* find second dim, if any. */
00316         bp = strchr(bp, '[');
00317         if (!bp) {
00318                 return 1; /* at least we got the first dim. */
00319         }
00320         num = 0;
00321         while (++bp < name+len-1) {
00322                 const char c = *bp;
00323                 if (c == ']') {
00324                         break;
00325                 }
00326                 if (c <= '9' && c >= '0') {
00327                         num *= 10;
00328                         num += (c - '0');
00329                 } else {
00330                         printf("array2 parse error.\n");
00331                         return 1;
00332                 }
00333         }
00334         if (dim1) {
00335                 if (dim2) {
00336                         *dim1 = *dim2;
00337                         *dim2 = num;
00338                 } else {
00339                         *dim1 = num;
00340                 }
00341         }
00342 
00343         return 1;
00344 }

00347 // ----------------------------------------------------- //
00348 void bDNA::init(char *data, int len, bool swap)
00349 {
00350         int *intPtr=0;short *shtPtr=0;
00351         char *cp = 0;int dataLen =0;
00352         //long nr=0;
00353         intPtr = (int*)data;
00354 
00355         /*
00356                 SDNA (4 bytes) (magic number)
00357                 NAME (4 bytes)
00358                 <nr> (4 bytes) amount of names (int)
00359                 <string>
00360                 <string>
00361         */
00362 
00363         if (strncmp(data, "SDNA", 4)==0)
00364         {
00365                 // skip ++ NAME
00366                 intPtr++; intPtr++;
00367         }
00368 
00369 
00370 
00371         // Parse names
00372         if (swap) 
00373         {
00374                 *intPtr = ChunkUtils::swapInt(*intPtr);
00375         }
00376         dataLen = *intPtr;
00377         intPtr++;
00378 
00379         cp = (char*)intPtr;
00380         int i;
00381         for ( i=0; i<dataLen; i++)
00382         {
00383                 bNameInfo info;
00384                 info.m_name = cp;
00385                 info.m_isPointer = (info.m_name[0] == '*') || (info.m_name[1] == '*');
00386                 name_is_array(info.m_name,&info.m_dim0,&info.m_dim1);
00387                 m_Names.push_back(info);
00388                 while (*cp)cp++;
00389                 cp++;
00390         }
00391 
00392         
00393         cp = b3AlignPointer(cp,4);
00394         
00395 
00396         /*
00397                 TYPE (4 bytes)
00398                 <nr> amount of types (int)
00399                 <string>
00400                 <string>
00401         */
00402 
00403         intPtr = (int*)cp;
00404         assert(strncmp(cp, "TYPE", 4)==0); intPtr++;
00405 
00406         if (swap) 
00407         {
00408                 *intPtr = ChunkUtils::swapInt(*intPtr);
00409         }
00410         dataLen = *intPtr;
00411         intPtr++;
00412 
00413         cp = (char*)intPtr;
00414         for ( i=0; i<dataLen; i++)
00415         {
00416                 mTypes.push_back(cp);
00417                 while (*cp)cp++;
00418                 cp++;
00419         }
00420 
00421 
00422         cp = b3AlignPointer(cp,4);
00423 
00424         /*
00425                 TLEN (4 bytes)
00426                 <len> (short) the lengths of types
00427                 <len>
00428         */
00429 
00430         // Parse type lens
00431         intPtr = (int*)cp;
00432         assert(strncmp(cp, "TLEN", 4)==0); intPtr++;
00433 
00434         dataLen = (int)mTypes.size();
00435 
00436         shtPtr = (short*)intPtr;
00437         for ( i=0; i<dataLen; i++, shtPtr++)
00438         {
00439                 if (swap)
00440                         shtPtr[0] = ChunkUtils::swapShort(shtPtr[0]);
00441                 mTlens.push_back(shtPtr[0]);
00442         }
00443 
00444         if (dataLen & 1) shtPtr++;
00445 
00446         /*
00447                 STRC (4 bytes)
00448                 <nr> amount of structs (int)
00449                 <typenr>
00450                 <nr_of_elems>
00451                 <typenr>
00452                 <namenr>
00453                 <typenr>
00454                 <namenr>
00455         */
00456 
00457         intPtr = (int*)shtPtr;
00458         cp = (char*)intPtr;
00459         assert(strncmp(cp, "STRC", 4)==0); intPtr++;
00460 
00461         if (swap) 
00462         {
00463                 *intPtr = ChunkUtils::swapInt(*intPtr);
00464         }
00465         dataLen = *intPtr;
00466         intPtr++;
00467 
00468 
00469         shtPtr = (short*)intPtr;
00470         for ( i=0; i<dataLen; i++)
00471         {
00472                 mStructs.push_back (shtPtr);
00473                 if (swap)
00474                 {
00475                         shtPtr[0]= ChunkUtils::swapShort(shtPtr[0]);
00476                         shtPtr[1]= ChunkUtils::swapShort(shtPtr[1]);
00477 
00478                         int len = shtPtr[1];
00479                         shtPtr+= 2;
00480 
00481                         for (int a=0; a<len; a++, shtPtr+=2)
00482                         {
00483                                 shtPtr[0]= ChunkUtils::swapShort(shtPtr[0]);
00484                                 shtPtr[1]= ChunkUtils::swapShort(shtPtr[1]);
00485                         }
00486                 }
00487                 else
00488                         shtPtr+= (2*shtPtr[1])+2;
00489         }
00490 
00491 
00492         // build reverse lookups
00493         for ( i=0; i<(int)mStructs.size(); i++)
00494         {
00495                 short *strc = mStructs.at(i);
00496                 if (!mPtrLen && strcmp(mTypes[strc[0]],"ListBase")==0)
00497                 {
00498                         mPtrLen = mTlens[strc[0]]/2;
00499                 }
00500 
00501                 mStructReverse.insert(strc[0], i);
00502                 mTypeLookup.insert(b3HashString(mTypes[strc[0]]),i);
00503         }
00504 }

00507 // ----------------------------------------------------- //
00508 int bDNA::getArraySize(char* string)
00509 {
00510         int ret = 1;
00511         int len = strlen(string);
00512 
00513         
00514         char* next = 0;
00515         for (int i=0; i<len; i++)
00516         {
00517                 char c = string[i];
00518 
00519                 if (c == '[')
00520                         next = &string[i+1];
00521                 else if (c==']')
00522                         if (next)
00523                                 ret *= atoi(next);
00524         }
00525 
00526 //      print (string << ' ' << ret);
00527         return ret;
00528 }

00531 void bDNA::dumpTypeDefinitions()
00532 {
00533         int i;
00534 
00535         int numTypes = mTypes.size();
00536         
00537         for (i=0;i<numTypes;i++)
00538         {
00539 
00540         }
00541 
00542         for ( i=0; i<(int)mStructs.size(); i++)
00543         {
00544                 int totalBytes=0;
00545                 short *oldStruct = mStructs[i];
00546 
00547                 int oldLookup = getReverseType(oldStruct[0]);
00548                 if (oldLookup == -1)
00549                 {
00550                         mCMPFlags[i] = FDF_NONE;
00551                         continue;
00552                 }
00553 
00554                 short* newStruct = mStructs[oldLookup];
00555                 char* typeName = mTypes[newStruct[0]];
00556                 printf("%3d: %s ",i,typeName);
00557                 
00558                 //char *name = mNames[oldStruct[1]];
00559                 int len = oldStruct[1];
00560                 printf(" (%d fields) ",len);
00561                 oldStruct+=2;
00562 
00563                 printf("{");
00564                 int j;
00565                 for (j=0; j<len; ++j,oldStruct+=2) {
00566                         const char* name = m_Names[oldStruct[1]].m_name;
00567                         printf("%s %s", mTypes[oldStruct[0]],name);
00568                         int elemNumBytes= 0;
00569                         int arrayDimensions = getArraySizeNew(oldStruct[1]);
00570 
00571                         if (m_Names[oldStruct[1]].m_isPointer)
00572                         {
00573                                 elemNumBytes = VOID_IS_8 ? 8 : 4;
00574                         } else
00575                         {
00576                                 elemNumBytes = getLength(oldStruct[0]);
00577                         }
00578                         printf(" /* %d bytes */",elemNumBytes*arrayDimensions);
00579                         
00580                         if (j == len-1) {
00581                                 printf(";}");
00582                         } else {
00583                                 printf("; ");
00584                         }
00585                         totalBytes+=elemNumBytes*arrayDimensions;
00586                 }
00587                 printf("\ntotalBytes=%d\n\n",totalBytes);
00588 
00589         }
00590         
00591 
00592 
00593 #if 0
00594         /* dump out display of types and their sizes */
00595         for (i=0; i<bf->types_count; ++i) {
00596                 /* if (!bf->types[i].is_struct)*/
00597                 {
00598                         printf("%3d: sizeof(%s%s)=%d",
00599                                 i,
00600                                 bf->types[i].is_struct ? "struct " : "atomic ",
00601                                 bf->types[i].name, bf->types[i].size);
00602                         if (bf->types[i].is_struct) {
00603                                 int j;
00604                                 printf(", %d fields: { ", bf->types[i].fieldtypes_count);
00605                                 for (j=0; j<bf->types[i].fieldtypes_count; ++j) {
00606                                         printf("%s %s",
00607                                                 bf->types[bf->types[i].fieldtypes[j]].name,
00608                                                 bf->names[bf->types[i].fieldnames[j]]);
00609                                         if (j == bf->types[i].fieldtypes_count-1) {
00610                                                 printf(";}");
00611                                         } else {
00612                                                 printf("; ");
00613                                         }
00614                                 }
00615                         }
00616                         printf("\n\n");
00617 
00618                 }
00619         }
00620 #endif
00621 
00622 }
